author: Johan_van_den_Heuvel
title: Let the tournament begin!
review:
While visiting a new store i noticed they had some of the new lego sets! :)
So i decided to take some home. Including this one, for just 7,95 EURO, 11 USD. It brings back some nice memories i have of set 6021. Ahh the good old days... :)
Well lets go to the pros and cons:

pros: 
-late 90s style knight! :D
-Black "skelleton" knight! real cool design!
-a white horse
-a black skelleton horse
-cool new weapons
-potential army building set

cons:
-not much to build.. but well, to be honoust, i dont really care.. ;)

Conclusion:

Overall its a good set. Personnaly i really like the skelleton army. It is a real cool novelty of the lego designers. Although i like the late 90s style knight even better! The knight has silver touches on the helmet! If you like knights, buy buy buy!!! At 7,95 EURO it is a real bargain. You get a real cool set. :)

author: Deinonychus
title: Joust about right.
review:
The Final Joust is just one of the handful of smaller sets in the new Castle theme that pits heroic Knights against an evil Skeleton Army. You've really got to think about what kind of plot developments would bring the Lead General into an honorable joust with the Black Knight Skeleton, but that aside, you really can't go wrong with a good LEGO jousting set.

The set is pretty much just what it looks like with no surprises. 62 pieces shake out to give you a jousting rail, weapons rack, weapons, and two mounted opponents for $8-$10 US. The pieces making up the rail and rack are, for the most part, basic bricks and plates and look as if they are the property of the Knights due to the blue and gold detailing and flags. The weapons in this set are plentiful. you get two lances, two shields, a basic sword, a scythe sword, an axe, and a flail, so once the lances "break" on the first pass, the combatants can switch to other instruments of pain.

The combatants are the centerpieces of the set and rightly so. The Lead General has printed chest armor and a helmet with a flip-up visor molded in silver. His horse has a golden headpiece and printed livery. When fully decked out with shield, sword, and lance this is a very cool knight. The Black Knight Skeleton, apparent leader of the undead army, is perched upon a black skeletal single-piece horse . His T-visored helmet covers a face with eerie red eyes, and the printed chest armor has a very cool ribcage-like pattern of metal plates decorating it. He has got to be one of the more impressive of the "full-bodied skeletons" in the theme. 

There's really not a whole heck of a lot you could build out of the pieces aside from what it is sold as. But when you get down to it, this set is nothing more then an excuse to pack a mounted Knight and mounted Skeleton Warrior together...which is a good thing by almost any calculation. 

This set is just barely, if not slightly short of being worth the price tag, but it is fun nonetheless and a must-have for any fan of the new Castle theme.

author: KIKO
title: You need to buy this..
review:
...if you are a Castle fan. You get a nice pair of weapons, 2 minifigs and 2 horses(one minifig is a skeleton and one horse is dead, too).

 

Pros

2 minifigs

2 horses

nice weapons

 

Cons

None, I guess.

author: omgbrick
title: Who will win!
review: For a ten dollar set this set has alot of weapons and a decent number of minifigs whch seems rare among todays Lego kits. To reprsent the skeleton army we have a sketon genenral in a new black skeleton horse unfortantly its made out of one piece and the head doesn't move. You also get the heroic knight represting the kings army he comes with a white horse with gold armor and a dressing to cover the rest of his body( I forget its name ) you also get a small weapons rack for when the jousting's over and regular fighting resumes. The devder isn't mch use but has lots of good pieces. Even if you don't like this theme you should still get it for parts. Still this set needs some squires for the knights. 4/5

author: j45per
title: small and clever
review:
this may be a small set but you get 2 of the best lego castle charicters out
1x general knight
1x black skeleton rider
1x black skeleton horce
1x normal horce

and 3 wepons that the minifigs can use

overall a small but cool set

author: reidak49
title: awesome
review: nice joust there is gold pieces several wepons a axe a flail and sword a white skellton in black armor and the scary face and i like the knights horse i looks like a a horse and the sketon horse is creative  im leaving now

author: benners30
title: cool!
review:
this set is awesome! it is basically an army builder for both sides. it has a cool skelli horse, a dark skelli, a knight who has cool armor, a cool horse with armor! it also has the thing in the middle and an accesory rack for weapons.

beautiful army builder

author: Nased
title: Great Duel
review:
I would give this little set a 10/10.

Reason 1: It cost me just $12SGD for a 62 pieces set and I get quite a lot of goodies.

Reason 2: The weapons include 1 grey lance, 1 short sword, 1 axe and 1 big crown shield for the Crown Knight. The evil black skeleton knight has 1 black lance, 1 flail, 1 awesome scythe and 1 big skeleton shield. The helmets and armour are unique to the good and evil forces.

Reason 3: I get 2 great mini figures and 2 horses(1 normal white horse and 1 black skeleton horse. There's a rack for the additional weapons and a barrier thingy to spice up the scene of the final joust.

Reason 4: These 2 figures are Knights and they can act as the generals/commanders to the crown knights and skeleton army. Great!

In conclusion, I have gotten one set and I think it is good to have at least one of this set. It's up to personal preference if you would like to get more. I like this set a lot and I would really give it a perfect 10.

author: Gus_263
title: The final joust
review: This set is small in comparison with some other castle sets with joust (some lassic castle sets were more small than this but some other were bigger), but still cool, altough have no much new thigs and also not much classic castle sets characteristics. The set includes two minifigures, on, with the same face of the Rascus (one of the 2004-2005 knights kingdom theme) and same design, printed details and armors of other knights of the current castle theme, but this is useful and stay cool. The skeleton minifigure is the most complete of the skeleton minifigures, due to the armors and helmet, that stay good in it. The skeleton is the same in designs like others, too in the head, but this design still nice. The two horses are different, one is a black skeleton of a horse and the other is a white horse with gold and blue coloured armors. The weapons include are useful, like the flail, axe, the two different styles of swords, shields and the joust spears. The few building included is on the little wall that the weapons stay guarded, and it is made with some blocks in the gray, blue and some gold colors, that are increased with two little flags, but this small wall don't still in feet sometimes. The joust can be played with the rail, made with some blocks like the small in bridge shape, with gray color, increased with other blocks with few brown color, some blue and gold increased. The rail is good builted for a little, but it don't stay in feet so much. Overall, altough the building is not the best for a joust, this nicely designed small is a cheap option to get a small castle set, much better than the impulse.

author: lego12
title: This set has SO many RARE pieces!
review:
This set is so cool and it has so many pros:) and so little cons:( that i'll give you the list.....

 Pros:

1. The knight mask is really rare and cool!

2. The knight's and the Skeleton's armour is really unique and the first of its kind that I have seen.

3. The weapons are really cool and you get a lot of them.

4. The horses are so cool that it is the reason I couldn't resist this set!

Cons:

1. The weapons rack tips over if not on a solid surface.

3. It is hard to place the Lance, or the long things to knock each off their horses, on the minifiures hands because the horse is blocking the posbility to do so.

That is the only problems with this set which are not a lot. So thanks for reading this and have good day!
                Lego12

author: the_brickster
title: Cool- but too expensive
review:
well, the set has a few things and everything is decorated though theres not much to decorate. I got this for $10 and over all the sets cool but waaayy overpriced.
Pros:
-cool knight with cool armour.
-cool skeleton with ribcag-ish armour and "battle worn" shield
-lots of weapons  
-jousting thingy that stops the knights from getting of their horses and starting a punch-up
Cons:
- overpriced
- skeleton wears a sweater(a present from the evil wisard, perhaps? or maybe he's too modest to show his bare ribcage.)
- knights head is fat when you look from the front-i mean it.
- no trophy
- nothing else so it looks bare- i fixed this by adding a gateway that looks like a castle, a spectators bench with food, some guy with a video camera on a cherry picker and with some more horses.

author: greenfrog_7
title: The Final Joust... there were others?
review: Getting past the situation where a skeleton knight is engaged in an organized joust with a knight, this set is satisfying and a good entry for the Castle sets. A nice assortment of accessories accompany two mounted knight figures, always a plus. As well, while I personally do not find the set to be that great as far as playability, it does look pretty neat on display - helped by it's small size in this category since it is easy to find space for it.

author: Lint
title: Must Buy
review:
Pros

*Weapons a plenty
*2 horses (one armoured horse)
*Fully armoured Knight General and Undead Champion
*Palisade is a wonderful touch and is a useful addition to any castle scenery
*Black skeleton horsey
*Did I mention the weapons are awesome
*Great value for money

Cons
*Yeah the skeleton horseys have no articulation whatsoever, but thats something we all have to live with.

author: JohnnyB87
title: A well rounded set
review:
While it may not include an abundance of pieces, the pieces it does include are quite useful. I suppose I'll start off with the two minifigs and two horses as they are likely to be the main attraction. 

The knight is very well suited for battle, including a visor helm and detailed Crown breastplate. The visor can indeed hold plume, which is great for customization. The white horse he is riding is definitely ready for some rough times ahead. He has a pearl gold armored helm paired with a highly detailed barding that I have only seen in this set (blue/gold color combination). Like the LEGO horses of the past, this horse's head/neck moves up and down.

The skeleton has the torso and legs of a normal minifig and both pieces are purely black with a red belt. He comes with an older style black helm and a black breastplate with an armored ribcage print. He has white hands and a white head. Dressed almost all in black does make him seem quite evil. His horse is black as well with no points of articulation due to cost constraints. Overall, a very imposing opponent. A sidenote, my skeleton's arms are black and not red as displayed on Brickset's picture.

Each minifig has a wide selection of accessories to equip, including but may not be limited to: a full Crown shield, a full skeletal shield, a flail, a sword, a poleaxe, a jousting stick/pike for each minifig, and a skeletal sword that can transform into a scythe due to its handle grips.

The jousting fence is very simple but does its job as a divider. The good thing is, many of the parts are good for building up a castle or tower. The weapon rack is actually very useful and comes with two great looking flags that are dark blue and metallic gold in color.

This set may not look like much, but it has everything one is likely to expect for the price and perhaps then some. Two opposing forces and a wide array of weapons bring a decent amount of playability into this set.

author: just2good
title: Good figs
review:
At K-Mart, I got this set for $4! Lucky me! :D
Pros:
2 mini figs
Weapon rack
Goldish elements
Skeleton Horse (in black)!
Horse
Weapons
Joust Sticks

author: the_lead_general
title: possibility
review:
The final joust.

Plus+
     Great minifigures, the knight has a great breastplate, helmet, face and shield. Cool black skeleton horse, dark knight, great horse for the good knight, there is nothing bad with both horsemen. The tilt is great and the golden caps are a good touch. Also the flags on the weapon rack are useful if you put them on the end of the knights lance. The two new skeleton weapons are great.

Minus-
      The golden caps face only one side and look strange. The skeleton horse can't hold any weapons like the good knight's can. They could add a page in the set for the knight and add a $ or 2.

Equals=
       A great set to boost both the bad and good sides of your  castle kingdom. Well priced at $9-12 and in all a very nice set.

Compatibility
             This set goes great with any set lacking characters in the knights/skeletons theme. For example: Kings castle siege, one with two crossbow catapults, one with the dock. It won't go with tower raid because it has trolls.

author: Qu
title: Let the tournament begin.
review:
INTRODUCTION
This is everything you need to have a great tournament between the forces of good and evil. It starts with a sword duel, progresses to an axe-mace duel and ends with a joust.

MINIFIGS
It comes with two, the crown night's general and the black skeleton general. The crown general is the same one that appears in sets 7048 and 7094. The skeleton general is only available in this playset. They both have amour and helmets, but plain torsos.

ACCESSORIES
This set comes with a lot. For the general there is a shield, sword, battle axe and silver lance. For the skeleton there is a shield, scythe blade, mace and chain and black lance. There is a simple weapons rack that can hold three accessories and two can clip onto the general's saddle.

THE WEAPONS RACK
I use it mainly for shields but you can pretty much use it to hold anything. There are two banners flying above it that show it is used by the crown general.

THE RAIL
It should have been a little longer, but I like the design. It allows knights to joust to their hearts content. I really like the parts on top of it.

WHAT IT NEEDS
Not much here, other that a longer jousting rail.

PROS AND CONS
  • Pros
  • Two minifigs.
  • Lots of accessories.
  • Nicely designed weapons rack and rail.
  • Black skeleton horse.
  • Rare Horse amour.
  • Cons
  • Rail is to short.
Over all a great set that's worth your money.

author: keexko
title: Favorite display
review:
I have this set displayed in my room! It's pretty cool. Let's go over it:

Pros:
- Minifigs
The human minifig is exactly how you expect it. The skeleton however, is something else. It is better than the other skeletons out there as it comes in a human torso!
- Lots of accessories to choose from
- Horses look outta this world
I especially love the barding on the crown horse and the color they gave to the skeleton horse.

Cons:
It's hard to incorporate a "Final Joust" scenario, when your playing.

author: CrzyLCF
title: Pretty good set
review:
This set didn't look much when i first bought it, but when I built it was well worth it!

Pros:

- Amazing number of accessories (6 weapons and 2 shields)
- Phenomenal knight with rear headgear
- Cool skeleton with human torso (otherwise only available in king's castle siege)
- Black Skeleton Horse!
- White Horse with armor and helmet

Cons:

- Don't like the idea of putting both the skeleton's and knight's weapons on the same weapon rack (LEGO should have at least made 2 seperate racks)

Overall: I would recommend this set to anyone for the number of accessories, minifigs and armor. I just wanted this set to have had a little more flair. Like maybe this set should have had a small arena with 2 spectators to make it seem more real. But that's just my opinion. I give this set a 4/5.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Castle (Fantasy Era) - The Final Joust
review:
The The Final Joust (7009) is a LEGO Castle (Fantasy Era) set which came out in 2007. It comes with 2 minifigs and 62 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.


[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7009-1.jpg[/img]


Box/Instructions


The box and the instructions are very nice. As I told you at the beginning: There're no mistakes in the instructions. Recommended age is 5-12. On the back of the box you can see the knights fighting.


Parts


The parts are very nice. We get some golden pieces but they're not shiny. There're also dark blue pieces, gray pieces and some brown pieces.

Minifigures



Human: The human comes with a gray torso, dark gray pants, a gray helmet, a gray visor and a printed armor. On his face you can see a black hair with a black beard. He has a shield with a crown on it and a gray lance.

Skeleton: The skeleton comes with a black torso, black pants, a dark red belt, a black helmet, and a black armor. His skull has red eyes. The skeleton has a nice shield with a skull on it and he comes with a black lance.


The build

The build is very easy. First you have to build the barrier and then the cache for the weapons. I'm sure you won't need longer than 10 minutes to build this set.

The completed model


The completet model is okay. We get a cache for the weapons with 2 flags on the top. We also get a barrier and 2 horses. One horse is a black skeleton horse and the other one is a white horse with some nice armor pieces. I think this is just a set to get for weapons and for minifigs. This set does almost have no play features.


[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7009-1.jpg[/img]


Positive:
Minifigs
Nice starter set
Weapons
Nice army builder
Pieces for brickfilms and MOC's
No stickers

Negative:


This set does almost have no play features
Not challenging for older kids and adults

Summary


All in all this set is okay and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1

Stopmotion 2

Review

author: jimmybrick
title: Great Army Builder
review:
This is a really good set because it has two minifigures and other parts that are really hard to get.

Pros:

Skeleton army leader (exclusive!)

you don't have to buy the king's siege to get lead general

armored horse

black skeleton horse

cool armor

lots of weapons

Cons:

should come with a chrome silver sword

author: mragonrider
title: Great set for the price!
review: When my brother bought me this set, i had no idea how much it cost. but I really liked all the cool weapons, minifigs and accessories like the horses and armor. I couldn't believe it was only 7.99! that's a great price for a set with such cool pieces! it's fun to play with as a jousting set, but also with all the exotic pieces, you can really have fun arming other minifigs. It's an especially good set to buy if you're interested in collecting rare pieces. I give it a 4 out of 5 bricks.

author: AETerry
title: Final Joust Review
review:
Looking at this set, I know I got it as a Christmas gift, as given the name of the set and that I already have another Jousting Set, I wouldn't have picked it out for myself. But in retrospect, I am very glad to have gotten this. You get two minifigures, a Knight on horse back featuring some of the new print designs for the Fantasy Era theme and a Black Skeleton on a Black Skeleton horse. There's the divider fence for the two to joust, run down past and a weapons rack with a variety of weapons for the combatants to use.

 

It's good for all the elements and minifigures involved, it just seems strange to me that a Knight is going to joust a Skeleton like it's a fair combat or Tournament Fair. The build is fairly simple, though solid for a set this size and it's purpose. Also can make a semi-decent army build too with the Knight and Skeleton.

author: Sauron_Bauglir
title: Small but Good
review:
I like this set, even though it is small. It makes a great army builder for cavalry and has great parts and weapons. I won't do a long review because it is so small, but it is worth the money.

Parts

The strongest part of this set. All of the parts are good, especially the spare weapons.

Minifigures

The Lead General- This is the greatest Knight in Lego Castle, in my opinion. His horse is amazing, his armour and weapons and face are too. 9.5/10.

Skeleton General- Also an amazing figure! He is different to the General that you get in King's Castle Siege (7094). I would say that the two Skeleton generals are equal. His horse is cool as well. 9.5/10.

The completed model

It makes a good jousting tournament! Obviously not as good as Kingdoms Joust (10223), as that set is massive, but you can have fun with it definitely!

Summary

A great little set! Worth NZ$12, which I paid for it. Any fan can start their collection with this, and you must get it if you are a big Castle fan! 7/10.
